name: Carnaween House

reviews.text: Carnaween is one of those places where if you don't expect it to be perfect it won't disappoint . The views are lovely and its spotlessly clean , Food is hit and miss sometimes but we had a lovely meal there in July .
reviews.title: Lovely views .

reviews.text: I'm a local, just up the road in Glenties & often go out for meals in Carnaween & have yet to have a bad experience. The food is class, the only minor criticism I have is dessert. They make their own deserts & they are lovely but its the variety I would like to see changed. They do crumbles & meringues & things but I have a savage sweet tooth & would like to see more on the menu. That said its a minor thing & probably a personal thing that wouldn't even bother others. I love the duck there, also I would recommend the chowder. One thing is for sure you won't leave hungry. We like to go down especially at halloween when there are fireworks on the beach across the road. Overall a really high standard of food & nice staff.
reviews.title: Lovely Evening Meal

reviews.text: Recommended by our cottage owners for Sunday lunch. Absolutely fantastic food, relaxed setting, quiet, views spectacular. Will be going there again twice in May 2012. Weather was wet but it didnt matter at all.
reviews.title: Sunday lunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great views, comfortable room and superb dinner and breakfast. Just so relaxing and wish we were going back sooner than March 2012. Can't wait
reviews.title: Just excellent

reviews.text: Beauiful location lovely decor arlene marvelous host breakfast very well presented consisting of local produce. Dinner superb and serviced to high standard. Would make great family retreat. We are considering for our next visit to book all nine rooms for wider family weekend.
reviews.title: a gem

aka: Carnaween House Narin-Portnoo, Ireland - County Donegal
